messages.subject: HENA 2008 Conference Schedule
messages.msgSnippet: THERE S STILL TIME TO REGISTER ! Until Friday, February 15, 2008! HENA 2008 Conference Homeschooling = Infinite Possibilities! Saturday & Sunday, March 1-2,
messages.messageBody:
THERE'S STILL TIME TO REGISTER !
Until Friday, February 15, 2008!
HENA 2008 Conference
Homeschooling = Infinite Possibilities!
Saturday & Sunday, March 1-2, 2008
LL Building, Arizona State University, Tempe, AZ
www.HENA.us conference@...
Our Speaker Schedule is NOW up
www.hena.us/ConferenceSchedule.html

While you browse the exhibit hall and listen to speakers, your
kids can enjoy (with another parent or caregiver) :

KID'S ACTIVITIES! - www.hena.us/conferenceFunshops.html
LL 114 – Teen Hangout Room
LL 113 – Active room! Hopscotch, Four square and bean bag toss,
including Paula's Jam Session!
LL 112 – Video Gaming Room - Game Cube, Free wireless – WoW,
anyone? Bring your laptops! Bring your Game Cube games (to add
variety to the few we will already have available) and bring your
game systems
LL 111 – Art Room
LL 110 – Games! With David the "Game Guy" - Bring your card games
and other board games
LL 109 – Movie Room
LL 108 – LEGO/Kids Activity Room sponsored by Rainbow Learners and
EarthScouts
LL 13 – FAMILY ROOM – downstairs next to main speaker room and
vendor rooms!
- Family/Connections Room
- Wooden Trains
- Toddler Toys (we have tons)
- Connections board - leave notes to meet up with others.
- Art table to display children's creations!
- Silent Auction - to bid on what you want to do
- Science Guy will have free science kit for everyone
- Desert Bells will have bells to play
- "Garbage Glitter" - making art out of recycled junk
Laptops welcome Free Internet!  Kids can...
Share pictures of their activities
Get emails and connect with others
Watch their own movies from home
Connect to game sites and play against real people
Bring your cameras for Photos of...
Events
Projects your children have completed
Lego projects that can be uploaded to the Lego site
For the HENA conference site next year
Rock Band instruments welcome for a jam session!
Bring your instrument, amp, microphone
Coordinate with others on music
Check the website for tunes to practice to
Take your talent onto the ASU campus and play on the quads and in
the Talent show!
Consider being available during part of the conference to teach
younger kids about your instrument, and let them try it out
We need:
- Wii
- Guitar Hero
- Recycled junk for our Garbage Glitter Activity
- Sewing scraps (cloth, thread, needles, sequins, etc.)
- Magazines so the kids can cut them up for collages
- Tape:  duct, paint, masking, packing for Garbage Glitter area
- Old t-shirts and canvas tote bags for fabric painting
- Volleyball net and ball
- Badminton equipment
- Racquet balls (we have a fun game for these)
- Rubber/bouncy balls
Talent Show – Sunday afternoon is the time to show off – for all
ages! Contact Mark Fox (markfox@...) to register.
… and more!
GREAT BINGO PRIZES --- SILENT AUCTION ---
CONFERENCE BAGS FULL OF INFO --- FUN!

The Home Education Network of Arizona is an inclusive statewide
support organization that respects, values, and finds strength in
diversity. We are neutral in matters of religion and partisan
politics and we respect each other's educational choices. HENA's
mission is to create an environment in which all home educating
families in Arizona can share resources, find support, and build
community.
Visit www.hena.us
 
**PLEASE SHARE THIS EMAIL WITH YOUR GROUPS, LISTS, AND FRIENDS**


This email was sent to unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com.
